task_summary: Pick up the red object (cylinder) from the table using a top grasp.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robotic arm identifying and picking up a red cylindrical object from a tabletop workspace. The robot first ensures the object is visible, scans if needed, then opens its gripper, moves above the object, computes a top grasp, approaches and aligns itself, lowers until contact is detected, closes the gripper to grasp, and confirms the object is securely held. The procedure relies on visual cues and force feedback for robust execution.
preconditions: Red cylinder is present and accessible on the table
Robot gripper is empty and functional
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of the red cylinder
Scan workspace if the object is not visible
Detect the precise pose of the red cylinder
Open gripper in preparation for grasp
Compute a suitable top grasp pose
Approach and align to the grasp pose with tight tolerance
Lower until gentle contact with the object is made
Close the gripper to grasp the object
Verify the object is held and the grasp is stable
success_criteria: Red cylinder is securely grasped by the gripper
Object lifts off from the table without dropping
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect object: scan again up to 3 attempts
Unstable grasp: retry the approach and/or close the gripper
Object not grasped: abort and re-initiate the approach
task_long_description.termination: The behavior terminates when the red cylinder is reliably held by the gripper and grasp stability is confirmed.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red cylinder is visible in the workspace.
Scans the workspace in a grid pattern for the red cylinder.
Detects the precise pose/location of the red cylinder.
Opens the gripper in preparation to grasp.
Moves the gripper above the red cylinder before grasp.
Computes a suitable top-down grasp pose for the object.
Approaches and aligns the gripper to the grasp pose using tight tolerance.
Lowers the gripper until contact is detected with moderate force.
Closes gripper to grasp the object with moderate force.
Checks if the object is grasped by the gripper.
Checks if the grasp is stable after gripping the object.

recovery_strategy: Repeat object search with up to 3 scan attempts
Retry grasp if not stable or object slips
Abort and alert if grasp fails repeatedly
assumptions: Red cylinder object is visible as a distinct, graspable item in all frames
Task instruction matches scene: red object present and accessible on table
No major environmental distractions or occlusions
No place phase present in these frames; termination occurs after successful grasp

expected_success_criteria: Red cylinder is held firmly by gripper at end of sequence
